data.title: Processing Archives
data.text:
Coldwater shrimp

Newfoundland shrimp plant not yet open as ice locks down port

Notre Dame Seafoods' plant in Twillingate, Newfoundland is yet to open this season; heavy ice and low shrimp quotas are symptomatic of season so far

North America

Pacific Seafood’s newly-acquired surimi plant still faces legal hurdles

By Jeanine Stewart

ODOJ's denial of immunity adds to legal hurdles at time when Michael Haglund, who has two other antitrust cases pending against company, files suit

Thai labor

Scientists launch global agenda to curb human rights abuses in seafood

Authored by Conservation International and a team of researchers at leading organizations, new paper calls on marine scientists to focus on social issues

Products

Cooke, Young’s, Icelanders behind Gadus deal bid for Seachill

By Tom Seaman

Seachill second round to feature ‘wide field’ of trade, investor players, featuring Canada’s Cooke, Young’s and the successful bidders for Gadus, sources told Undercurrent News

Processing

Greenpeace refutes claims made in Thai Union press release

Greenpeace refuted claims made by Thai Union in its recent press release saying the nonprofit had given it a 'leadership trophy' for sustainability, calling the move 'bizarre'

Asia drives seafood M&A

Nissui’s Cite Marine closes Halieutis deal, plans breaded expansion

By Tom Seaman

French processor Cite Marine has closed a deal for smaller rival Halieutis Fish & Co, as it also plans an expansion of its factory, sources told Undercurrent News

Europe

Dutch processor Visscher targets €100m revenue on new salmon line

By Neil Ramsden

The trimming line, capable of producing 4t of fillets per hour, should allow the firm to compete at retail; aim is to become more of a 'one-stop shop' with new species

Processing

Philippines’ Millennium Global takes 49% share in Vietnam exporter

The share in Pacific Seafoods Company will cost the group around $750,000

Sustainability

CP Foods-backed migrant worker project completes first year

Thailand's Fishermen’s Life Enhancement Centre, which fights for workers rights, has completed it’s the first year of operation
